column4: Hey Guys , After having the same problem as described here: http://start.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1009417, I have an MSI VR 630 too
My synatics mouse touch pad doesn't work after following the instructions there
does anyone know the solution
To get the mouse working
or manually load the mouse driver
Does anyone know how to manually load individual drivers
IdealOne: What is that?
IdeaOne: No I didn't do that, let me try that once, also did you get what's my problem?, it is this: http://start.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1009417  I have the same machine and same problem
apparently the touchpad has a kill switch to turn it off and on. Is the device enabled?
The device must be on
I followed the solution given here: http://start.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1009417
thats just a whole lot about installing the video drivers
What the thread I sent you?
yes, I'd try a reboot, then press alt+f2, type gnome-terminal, press enter and then run: dmesg | less
that output will hopefully show the device coming online
What the thread I sent you?)
as well as any issues, you may want to try some bootoptions to disable kernel functionality to hopefully get the device up
Ok how do I do that
all I could see in thee forum you pasted was about installing the nvidia drivers
yeah that's the only problem I have
i'd read dmesg first, see whats going on
I know what is boot options, my questions was what to be disabled in kernel
thanks, I' ll try that
